intro: Psychotria citrifolia, commonly known as the "little apple tree," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, apple-shaped berries that are yellow when ripe, hence its common name. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and a strong, sometimes unpleasant odor. Psychotria citrifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
